line_1: The trembling lovers sunk confus'd, aghast!
line_2: Near the green arbour Anselm musing pass'd;

line_1: Away, away — The Eagle, all agast,
line_2: Soars to the Sky, nor falters in her haste:

line_1: They start, they stare, they wheel, they look aghast:
line_2: A lifeless phantom near a garden plac'd:

line_1: They start, they stare, they wheel, they look aghast:
line_2: Of sport, of song, of pleasure, of repast;

line_1: They start, they stare, they wheel, they look aghast:
line_2: May no bold Briton's riper age e'er taste!

line_1: Tumultuously they rush: the chief aghast
line_2: The light built fabric ne'er can stand the blast,

line_1: Tumultuously they rush: the chief aghast
line_2: Beholds his throne o'erturned, his train dispersing fast.

line_1: Hope faulters, and the soul recoils aghast.
line_2: The trackless shores that never were repast!

line_1: E'en Leuwenhoek himself would stand aghast,
line_2: The propagated myriads spread so fast,

line_1: With down-cast Eye-lids, and with Looks a-ghast,
line_2: Shall dread the Future, or bewail the Past.

line_1: Where every genial feeling shrinks aghast.
line_2: Deform'd the airy scenery as it past;
I but survey bright Freedom's form at last,
Whence many wearied ere they had o'er-past
Ne one regardful look would ever backward cast.
